Modelling water and vegetation reciprocity.

By Thomas Gumbricht Google scholar Researchgate Scopus Linkedin Orcid

My PhD project “Modelling water and vegetation reciprocity - a landscape synthesis in GIS” is based on the results of several studies relating landscape patterns and processes. Some of the studies are explicitly included in the PhD thesis report, whereas others are only used as background material.

PhD thesis

  • Gumbricht, T., Royal Institute of Technology (KTH), Stockholm 1996. Modelling water and vegetation reciprocity -a landscape synthesis in GIS (PhD thesis).

Journal articles

  • Gumbricht, T., McCarthy, J., & Mahlander, C., Ecological Engineering, 6(4), 273–279 1996. Digital interpretation and management of land cover — a case study of Cyprus.
  • Gumbricht, T., & Thunvik, R., Nordic Hydrology (renamed: Hydrology Research), 28(4–5), 329–338 1997. 3D Hydrogeological Modelling with an Expert GIS Interface.

Refereed chapters

  • Chmiel, J., & Gumbricht, T., International Archives of Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing, 31(B4), 183–187 1996. Knowledge based classification of landscape objects combining satellite and ancillary data.
  • Gumbricht, T., Spatial Models and GIS: New and Potential Models (pp. 245–257) 2000. Dynamic modelling and landsacpe patterns - a GIS synthesis.
  • Gumbricht, T., Högelin, A., & Renman, G., Water saving strategies in urban renewal (pp. 129–141) 1996. Urban green mosaic and sustainable water processes.
  • Gumbricht, T., HydroGIS 96: Application of Geographic Information Systems in Hydrology and Water Resources Management. (Vol. IAHS Publ, pp. 115–121) 1996. Landscape interfaces and transparency to hydrological functions.

Conference proceedings

  • Gumbricht, T. Hessling: M and McCarthy, J., Nordic Hydrological Conference (Vol. 40, pp. 529-537) 1996. Hydrological modelling integrating landscape pattern - A case study of Cyprus.
  • Gumbricht, T., Hydrological processes in the catchment (pp. 37–48) 1995. Watershed structure and symmetry with runoff and water quality.
  • Teklemariam, S. and Gumbricht, T., Nordic Hydrological Conference, NHP-Report No. 44, pp. 625-630 1998. Hillslope landscape process and pattern analysis.
  • Gumbricht, T., Stockholm Water Symposium (pp. 181–183) 1997. Nested scales of life supporting processes and human justice.
  • Gumbricht, T., & Mccarthy, J., Geoinformatics (pp. 268–274) 1996. Transparent land surface modeling in GIS.
  • Mccarthy, J., & Gumbricht, T. (1996)., Geoinformatics (pp. 262–267) 1996. Application of coupled GIS-models for integrated landscape management.
  • Gumbricht, T., Nordic Hydrological Conference (Vol. 40, pp. 360–368) 1996. Hydroclimatic processes and spatiotemporal landscape patterns.
  • Gumbricht, T., Stockholm water symposium 1996 (pp. 42–44) 1996. Management of the water organized land surface.
